ContentsItem.ContentsTitle: The Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) (Amendment) Regulations 2018

SecondaryPrelims.Title: The Air Traffic Management (Amendment etc.) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019

ComingIntoForce.Text: Coming into force in accordance with regulation 1

P.Text: The Secretary of State makes these Regulations in exercise of the powers conferred by sections 8(1) and 23(1) of, and paragraph 21 of Schedule 7 to, the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018.

Para.Text: In accordance with paragraph 1(1) of Schedule 7 to that Act a draft of this instrument has been laid before Parliament and approved by a resolution of each House of Parliament.

P2para.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Air Traffic Management (Amendment etc.) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019.
These Regulations come into force on exit day.

Part.Title: Amendment and revocation of retained direct principal EU legislation

P1para.Text: Regulation (EC) No 549/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 10 March 2004 laying down the framework for the creation of the single European sky (the framework Regulation) is amended in accordance with regulations 3 to 18.

P2para.Text: Article 1 (objective and scope) is amended as follows.
In the heading, for “Objective and scope” substitute “Scope”.
Omit paragraph 1.
In paragraph 2—

P3para.Text: for “Member States’” substitute “the United Kingdom’s”,
for “their” substitute “its”, and
omit “of the Member States”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: in the first sentence, for “Member States” substitute “the United Kingdom”, and
omit the second sentence.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 4.
Article 2 (definitions) is amended as follows.
After point 14 insert—

P3para.Text: ‘the CAA’ means the Civil Aviation Authority;

P2para.Text: In point 15 (certificate) for “a national supervisory authority in any form complying with national law,” substitute “the national supervisory authority”.
In point 17 (European air traffic management network)—

P3para.Text: after “collection of” insert “relevant”,
omit the words beginning with “listed” and ending with “(the interoperability Regulation)”, and
at the end insert—

P1para.Text: For these purposes relevant systems are:

P3para.Text: systems and procedures for airspace management,
systems and procedures for air traffic flow management,
systems and procedures for air traffic services, in particular flight data processing systems, surveillance data processing systems and human-machine interface systems,
communications systems and procedures for ground-to-ground, air-to-ground and air-to-air communications,
navigation systems and procedures,
surveillance systems and procedures,
systems and procedures for aeronautical information services, and
systems and procedures for the use of meteorological information;

P2para.Text: In point 18 (concept of operation) for “EATMN” substitute “UK ATMS”.
In point 19 (constituents) after “of the” insert “UK ATMS with the”.
In point 28 (interoperability)—

P3para.Text: for “EATMN” substitute “UK ATMS”, and
after “efficient operation” insert “in relation to the EATMN”.

P2para.Text: In point 32 (procedure) after “throughout” insert “the UK ATMS and in relation to”.
In point 36 (seamless operation)—

P3para.Text: after “operation of” insert “the UK ATMS in relation to”, and
for “it functions as if it” substitute “the UK ATMS functions as if it and the EATMN”.

P2para.Text: After point 39 (system) insert—

P3para.Text: ‘United Kingdom air traffic management system’ or ‘UK ATMS’ means the collection of relevant systems enabling air navigation services in the United Kingdom to be provided, including the interfaces at boundaries with other countries and territories. For these purposes relevant systems are:
systems and procedures for airspace management,
systems and procedures for air traffic flow management,
systems and procedures for air traffic services, in particular flight data processing systems, surveillance data processing systems and human-machine interface systems,
communications systems and procedures for ground-to-ground, air-to-ground and air-to-air communications,
navigation systems and procedures,
surveillance systems and procedures,
systems and procedures for aeronautical information services, and
systems and procedures for the use of meteorological information;

P2para.Text: In point 41 (cross-border services)—

P3para.Text: for “one Member State” substitute “the United Kingdom”, and
for “another” substitute “a”.

P2para.Text: Article 3 (fields for action by the Community) is amended as follows.
In the heading omit “by the Community”.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: in the words before point (a) omit “for the creation of the single European sky”,
in the words after point (c), after “adopted” insert “before exit day”,
in those words for “regulations” substitute “Regulations”, and
at the end of those words insert “as well as with the regulations made on or after exit day by the Secretary of State under any of the Regulations referred to in this Article.”.

P2para.Text: Article 4 (national supervisory authorities) is amended as follows.
In the heading for “authorities” substitute “authority”.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “Member States” substitute “The Secretary of State”,
omit “, jointly or individually,”, and
for “their” substitute “the”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 2 for “authorities”, in both places it occurs, substitute “authority”.
In paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: for “National supervisory authorities” substitute “The national supervisory authority”,
for “their” substitute “its”,
after “powers” insert “under this Regulation and under the measures referred to in Article 3”, and
omit the words from “This shall be” to the end of the paragraph.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 4—

P3para.Text: for “Member States” substitute “The national supervisory authority”,
for “national supervisory authorities have” substitute “it has”,
for “them” substitute “it”, and
after “Regulation” insert “and under the measures referred to in Article 3”.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 5.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 5 (Committee procedure).
Omit Article 6 (industry consultation body).
Omit Article 7 (relations with European third countries).
Omit Article 8 (implementing rules).
Omit Article 9 (penalties).
Omit Article 10 (consultation of stakeholders).
Omit Article 11 (performance scheme).

P2para.Text: Article 12 (supervision, monitoring and methods of impact assessment) is amended as follows.
In the heading for “Supervision, monitoring and methods of impact assessment” substitute “Review”.
Omit paragraph 1.
In paragraph 2—

P3para.Text: for “The Commission” substitute “The Secretary of State”, and
omit the words beginning with “, and shall firstly” to the end of the paragraph.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 3.
In paragraph 4—

P3para.Text: for “The reports shall contain” substitute “The review must include”,
after “Regulation” insert “and to the measures referred to in Article 3”, and
omit “, in the light of the original objectives”.

P2para.Text: Article 13 (safeguards) is amended as follows.
In the first paragraph—

P3para.Text: after “Regulation” insert “and the measures referred to in Article 3”, and
omit “by a Member State”.

P2para.Text: In the first indent for “its responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the United Kingdom”.
In the fourth indent for “a Member State’s” substitute “the United Kingdom’s”.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 13a (European Aviation Safety Agency).
Omit Article 14 (entry into force).
After Article 14 omit the sentence which begins “This Regulation shall be binding”.

Regulation (EC) No 550/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 10 March 2004 on the provision of air navigation services in the single European sky (the service provision Regulation) is amended in accordance with regulations 20 to 44.
In Article 1 (scope and objective), in paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “in the single European sky” substitute “which form part of the UK ATMS”, and
for “the Community” substitute “the airspace under the responsibility of the United Kingdom”.

P2para.Text: Article 2 (tasks of the national supervisory authorities) is amended as follows.
In the heading for “authorities” substitute “authority”.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “authorities” substitute “authority”, and
for the words from “Member” to the end of the paragraph substitute “United Kingdom”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 2 for “each” substitute “the”.
Omit paragraphs 3 to 6.
Article 3 (qualified entities) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1 for “National supervisory authorities” substitute “The national supervisory authority”.
In paragraph 2—

P3para.Text: for “a national” substitute “the national”,
omit “within the Community”, and
omit the second sentence.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 4 (safety requirements).

P2para.Text: Article 6 (common requirements) is amended as follows.
The single paragraph becomes paragraph 1.

In that paragraph, for the first sentence substitute “The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument prescribe common requirements for the provision of air navigation services in the airspace under the responsibility of the United Kingdom.”.
After that paragraph insert—

P1para.Text: Regulations under paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: may make different provision for different purposes;
may make transitional, transitory or saving provision;
may make consequential, incidental or supplementary provision.

P1para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations under paragraph 1 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament..

P2para.Text: Article 7 (certification of air navigation service providers) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “within the Community” substitute “in the airspace under the responsibility of the United Kingdom”, and
for “Member States” substitute “the national supervisory authority”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 2 omit the words from “of the” to the end of the paragraph.
In paragraph 3 for “National supervisory authorities” substitute “The national supervisory authority”.
In paragraph 5—

P3para.Text: for “Member States” substitute “the national supervisory authority”,
for “their responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the United Kingdom”, and
omit the second sentence.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 6.
In paragraph 7—

P3para.Text: for “National supervisory authorities” substitute “The national supervisory authority”,
omit the second sentence, and
for “a national” substitute “the national”.

P2para.Text: For paragraph 8 substitute—

P1para.Text: Any certificate issued before exit day in a Member State in accordance with Article 7 of Regulation (EC) No 550/2004 which continues to be in force or effective on or after exit day by virtue of Part 3 of Schedule 8 to the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 is:

P3para.Text: to continue to be in force or effective on and after exit day for the remainder of its validity period up to a maximum of 2 years (subject to any earlier suspension or cancellation by the national supervisory authority); and

for the purposes of this Regulation and the other measures referred to in Article 3 of the framework Regulation, to be treated as if it was issued by the national supervisory authority in accordance with this Article.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 9.
Article 8 (designation of air traffic service providers) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “Member States”, in the first place those words occur, substitute “The national supervisory authority”,
for “their responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the United Kingdom”,
for “Member States”, in the second place those words occur, substitute “the national supervisory authority”, and
for “in the Community” substitute “issued in accordance with Article 7”.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 2.
In paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: for “Member States” substitute “The national supervisory authority”, and
for “their responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the United Kingdom”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 4 for “Member States” substitute “The national supervisory authority”.
Omit paragraphs 5 and 6.
Article 9 (designation of providers of meteorological services) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “Member States” substitute “The national supervisory authority”, and
for “their responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the United Kingdom”.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 2.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 9a (functional airspace blocks).
Omit Article 9b (functional airspace blocks system coordinator).

P2para.Text: Article 10 (relations between service providers) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1 for “in the Community” substitute “in accordance with Article 7”.
In paragraph 2 omit “or authorities concerned”.
In paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: for “Member States concerned”, in both places those words occur, substitute “the national supervisory authority”, and
for “they have” substitute “it has”.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 11 (relations with military authorities).

P2para.Text: Article 12 (transparency of accounts) is amended as follows.

In paragraph 1 for “the international accounting standards adopted by the Community” substitute “international accounting standards within the meaning of Regulation (EC) No 1606/2002 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 19 July 2002 on the application of international accounting standards (see Article 2 of that Regulation)”.
In paragraph 3 omit the words beginning with “, broken down” and ending with “Article 14”.
In paragraph 4—

P3para.Text: for “Member States shall designate the competent authorities that” substitute “The national supervisory authority”, and
for “their responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the United Kingdom”.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 5.

P1para.Text: In Article 13 (access to and protection of data), in paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: for “National supervisory authorities” substitute “The national supervisory authority”, and
omit the third sentence.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 14 (charging schemes: general).
Omit Article 15 (charging schemes: principles).
For Article 15a (common projects) substitute—

The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument make provision imposing on any person a requirement derived from a common project within the meaning of Article 15a of Regulation (EC) No 550/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 10 March 2004 on the provision of air navigation services in the single European sky, as that Regulation has effect in EU law as amended from time to time.
Regulations under paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: may make different provision for different purposes;
may make transitional, transitory or saving provision;
may make consequential, incidental or supplementary provision.

P1para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations under paragraph 1 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
Omit Article 16 (review of compliance).
For Article 17 (revision of annexes) substitute—
The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument amend Annex 1 or 2.
Regulations under paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: may make different provision for different purposes;
may make transitional, transitory or saving provision;
may make consequential, incidental or supplementary provision.

P1para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations under paragraph 1 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.

P2para.Text: Article 18 (confidentiality) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “authorities, acting in accordance with their national legislation” substitute “authority”, and
for “Commission” substitute “Secretary of State”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 2—

P3para.Text: for “national supervisory authorities” substitute “the national supervisory authority”, and
for “Commission” substitute “Secretary of State”.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 3.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 18a (review).
Omit Article 19 (entry into force).
After Article 19 omit the sentence which begins “This Regulation shall be binding”.
In Annex 1 (requirements for qualified entities)—

P3para.Text: in the sixth indent omit “concerned”, and
in the ninth indent omit the words from “recognised” to the end.

P1para.Text: In Annex 2 (conditions to be attached to certificates) omit point 1(a).

Regulation (EC) No 551/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 10 March 2004 on the organisation and use of the airspace in the single European sky (the airspace Regulation) is amended in accordance with regulations 46 to 55.

P2para.Text: Article 1 (objective and scope) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “in the Single European Sky” substitute “under the responsibility of the United Kingdom”, and
omit the words from “support” to “and to”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: for “and AFI regions where Member States are” substitute “region where the United Kingdom is”, and
omit the second sentence.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 4.

P1para.Text: Omit Article 3 (European Upper Flight Information Region).

P2para.Text: Article 3a (electronic aeronautical information) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1 for the words beginning with “Without” and ending with “cooperation” substitute “The national supervisory authority, working in consultation”.
In paragraph 2—

P3para.Text: in the opening words for “Commission” substitute “national supervisory authority”,
in point (a) for “ensure the development of a Community wide” substitute “contribute to the development of an”, and
in point (b) for “close cooperation” substitute “consultation”.

P2para.Text: Omit paragraph 3.
Article 4 (rules of the air and airspace classification) is amended as follows.
The unnumbered paragraph becomes paragraph 1.
In that paragraph, for the words before point (a) substitute—

P1para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument make provision to:

P2para.Text: In point (b) omit the words from “, in order” to the end.
At the end insert—

P1para.Text: Regulations under paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: may make different provision for different purposes;
may make transitional, transitory or saving provision;
may make consequential, incidental or supplementary provision.

P1para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations under paragraph 1 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament..

P2para.Text: Article 6 (network management and design) is amended as follows.
For paragraphs 1 to 5 substitute—

P1para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument make provision imposing requirements on any person in connection with the exercise by any person of the air traffic management (ATM) network functions.
The air traffic management (ATM) network functions are—

P3para.Text: the functions described in Article 6(2) of Regulation (EC) No 551/2004, as that regulation has effect in EU law as amended from time to time,
additional functions added to that list in accordance with Article 6(3) of that Regulation as it has effect in EU law as amended from time to time, and
functions under implementing rules adopted under Article 6(4) of that Regulation as it has, and as those rules have, effect in EU law as amended from time to time.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 6 for “Member States” substitute “The Secretary of State”.
In paragraph 7—

P3para.Text: for “Implementing rules for” substitute “The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument make provision about”,
omit the words beginning with “shall be developed” and ending with “Article 5(3) of the framework Regulation,”, and
for “These rules” substitute “Regulations under this paragraph”.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 8 for “The implementing rules for air traffic flow management” substitute “Regulations under paragraph 7”.
In paragraph 9 for “the implementing rules the Commission” substitute “regulations under paragraph 7 the Secretary of State”.
At the end insert—

P1para.Text: Regulations under paragraph 1 or 7—

P3para.Text: may make different provision for different purposes;
may make transitional, transitory or saving provision;
may make consequential, incidental or supplementary provision.

P1para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations under paragraph 1 or 7 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.

P2para.Text: Article 7 (flexible use of airspace) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 1—

P3para.Text: for “their responsibility” substitute “the responsibility of the Secretary of State”,
for “Member States” substitute “the persons mentioned in paragraph 1A”,
for “Single European Sky” substitute “UK ATMS”, and
omit “in the context of the common transport policy”.

P2para.Text: After that paragraph insert—

P1para.Text: Those persons are:

P3para.Text: any air navigation service provider,
the national supervisory authority, and
the Secretary of State.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 2—

P1para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory instrument make provision about the flexible use of airspace.
When making regulations under paragraph 3 the Secretary of State must have regard to the reports mentioned in paragraph 2.
Regulations under paragraph 3—

P3para.Text: may make different provision for different purposes;
may make transitional, transitory or saving provision;
may make consequential, incidental or supplementary provision.

P1para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations under paragraph 3 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament..
For Article 8 (temporary suspension) substitute—

P.Text: Article 7(1) does not apply if and to the extent that it gives rise to significant operational difficulties.

for the words beginning with “which” to the end of the paragraph substitute “to which the said Community specification relates, the Secretary of State may direct that paragraph 2 does not apply in relation to the specification. Accordingly, compliance with the essential requirements and/or the implementing rules for interoperability must not be presumed for systems, together with the associated procedures, or constituents that meet the specification.”.

P2para.Text: After paragraph (5) insert—

P1para.Text: As soon as possible after making a direction under paragraph 5 the Secretary of State must publish the direction in a way that the Secretary of State considers is likely to bring it to the attention of persons likely to be interested in it..

The declaration is, for the purposes of this Regulation and the other measures referred to in Article 3 of the framework Regulation, to be treated as a declaration made in accordance with this Article by a manufacturer established in the United Kingdom.

The declaration is, for the purposes of this Regulation and the other measures referred to in Article 3 of the framework Regulation, to be treated as a declaration submitted to the national supervisory authority in accordance with this Article.

P1group.Title: Article 2 of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No 716/2014

P2para.Text: Article 2 (definitions) is amended as follows.
In the first unnumbered paragraph—

P3para.Text: for “Implementing Regulation (EU) No 409/2013” substitute “Commission Regulation (EU) No 677/2011”, and
at the end of that paragraph insert “However, the definition of ‘operational stakeholders’ in Article 2(27) of Commission Regulation (EU) No 677/2011 does not apply.”.

P2para.Text: Omit point 3.
After point 5 insert—

‘ATM functionality’ means a group of ATM operational functions or services related to trajectory, airspace and surface management or to information sharing within the en-route, terminal, airport or network operating environments;

‘industrialisation’ of ATM functionalities means the activities and processes, following their validation that include standardisation, certification and production by the manufacturing industry (ground and airborne equipment manufacturers);

‘implementation’ of ATM functionalities means the procurement, installation and putting into service of equipment and systems, including associated operational procedures, carried out by operational stakeholders;

‘essential operational change’ means an Air Traffic Management (ATM) operational change that provides significant network performance improvements to the operational stakeholders, as referred to in the ATM Master Plan;
‘operational stakeholders’ means civil and military: airspace users, air navigation service providers and airport operators.

Chapter.Title: Amendment of the Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) Regulations 2013

P1group.Title: The Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) Regulations 2013

P2para.Text: The Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) Regulations 2013 are amended as follows.
In regulation 2 (interpretation) omit the definition of “air navigation services”, “air navigation service providers”, “air traffic services” and “meteorological services”.

In regulation 3 (national supervisory authority), in paragraph (2) for “regulations 3(1) and (4) apply” substitute “paragraph (1) applies or to which Article 12(4) of the service provision Regulation applies”.
Omit regulation 4 (designation of the competent authority).
Omit regulation 5 (tasks and functions of the CAA under the service provision Regulation).
Omit regulation 6 (tasks and functions of the CAA under the interoperability Regulation).
Omit regulation 7 (regional cooperation).
In regulation 8 (review) omit paragraph (2).
Omit Schedule 2 (list of implementing rules made under Article 3 of the interoperability Regulation for which the CAA is the enforcing authority).

Chapter.Title: Amendment of the Air Navigation (Single European Sky) (Penalties) (Amendment) Order 2018

P1group.Title: The Air Navigation (Single European Sky) (Penalties) (Amendment) Order 2018

P1para.Text: Omit articles 3(a) and 4 to 6 of the Air Navigation (Single European Sky) (Penalties) (Amendment) Order 2018 (which update references to “the common charging scheme regulations”).

Chapter.Title: Amendment of the Airport Charges (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2018

P1para.Text: Omit regulation 3(1) of the Airport Charges (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2018.

Chapter.Title: Revocation of the Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) (Amendment) Regulations 2018

P1group.Title: The Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) (Amendment) Regulations 2018

P1para.Text: The Single European Sky (National Supervisory Authority) (Amendment) Regulations 2018 are revoked.

Para.Text: Signed by authority of the Secretary of State for Transport
(This note is not part of the Regulations)

P.Text: These Regulations are made in exercise of the powers in sections 8(1) and 23(1) of, and Schedule 7 to, the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 (c.16) in order to address failures of retained EU law to operate effectively and other deficiencies arising from the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union.

These Regulations make amendments and revocations to legislation in the field of air traffic management. Part 2 covers retained direct principal EU legislation, Part 3 covers retained direct minor EU legislation, Part 4 covers EU decisions, Part 5 amends the European Economic Area agreement, and Part 6 amends subordinate UK legislation.
Of note in these Regulations are the following changes.
Regulation 4(10) defines the UK air traffic management system.

Regulation 13 revokes the powers enabling the establishment of the EU’s performance scheme for air navigation service and network functions. Regulation 328 revokes the EU’s implementing regulation that provides the detail for the EU’s performance scheme.

Regulation 28 revokes the powers enabling the establishment of the EU’s functional airspace blocks. Regulation 29 revokes the powers to designate a person as a functional airspace block system coordinator.

Regulations 34 and 35 revoke the establishment and principles of the EU’s common charging scheme for air navigation services. Regulation 329 revokes the EU’s implementing regulation that provides the detail for the EU’s charging scheme.

Regulations 57 to 63 amend articles 4, 5, 6, 6a and 7 of, and Annexes 3 and 4 to of Regulation (EC) 552/2004. Regulation (EC) 552/2004 was repealed by article 139(2) of Regulation (EU) 2018/1139 subject to the savings provisions specific to those amended articles. Those saved articles shall continue to apply until the adoption of delegated acts referred to in article 47 of Regulation (EU) 2018/1139 insofar as those acts cover the subject matter of the relevant provisions of Regulation (EC) 552/2004, and in any case shall continue to apply until not later than 12 September 2023.
Legislation and a Decision concerning the EU’s SESAR (Single European Sky ATM (Air Traffic Management) Research) programme are revoked by regulations 64, 74, 82 and 368.

A full impact assessment has not been produced for this instrument, as no significant impact on the private or voluntary sectors is foreseen. An Explanatory Memorandum has been published alongside these Regulations on www.legislation.gov.uk.
